text: EXCLUSIVE: The Motion Picture Sound Editors is doing its part to help with relief efforts amid the ongoing fire disaster in Los Angeles County. The group is donating $50,000 to the Entertainment Community Fund’s LA Fire Relief Fund, which is focused on providing emergency financial assistance to entertainment industry professionals impacted by this week’s wildfires. The 72-year-old global sound artists org also created an online community forum to facilitate communication and support among its members. And it will match up to another $50,000 of donations made through the MPSE donation portal for a total of $100,000. EXCLUSIVE: The Motion Picture Sound Editors is doing its part to help with relief efforts amid the ongoing fire disaster in Los Angeles County. The group is donating $50,000 to the Entertainment Community Fund’s LA Fire Relief Fund, which is focused on providing emergency financial assistance to entertainment industry professionals impacted by this week’s wildfires.

The 72-year-old global sound artists org also created an online community forum to facilitate communication and support among its members. And it will match up to another $50,000 of donations made through the MPSE donation portal for a total of $100,000.

Watch on Deadline

“Our hearts are with everyone whose lives have been affected by this tragic and devastating catastrophe,” said MPSE President David Barber. “The MPSE is actively seeking ways to assist our members and others in need. The Entertainment Community Fund is a top-rated charity that is well positioned to offer some direct and timely financial relief to members of the arts and entertainment industries.”

RELATED: “Unbelievable Devastation”: Disney Donates $15M To Help L.A. Recover & Rebuild From Wildfires

The MPSE Board of Directors convened Thursday night specifically to address the impact of the fires on the entertainment community.

“Professional and personal studios have been destroyed along with equipment and gear,” Barber added. “Many of us have resources such as gear, equipment, computers, software licenses, furniture, space, etc., to donate directly to other members who have lost everything as they face the challenging roads ahead. This online portal on our website connects those who can give with those who need it.”
